item.title: After Backlash, Ukraine Votes to Restore Watchdogs’ Powers
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky’s move last week to neuter two anticorruption agencies drew the country’s first street protests since Russia’s invasion.

item.title: Amid Scramble for Food, Prices in Gaza Reach Extraordinary Heights
item.description: Obtaining humanitarian aid can be difficult and dangerous, and though some essentials are available at markets, they are prohibitively expensive for m...

item.title: Russian Drones and Missiles Strike Kyiv
item.description: Russia launched a barrage of drones and missiles on the Ukrainian capital early Thursday, killing several people and injuring dozens.

item.title: Russian Missile and Drone Attack Pummels Kyiv, Killing at Least 7
item.description: The assault came soon after President Trump threatened new sanctions against Moscow if the bloodshed didn’t let up.

item.title: Myanmar Lifts State of Emergency, Paving the Way for Disputed Vote
item.description: The military government hopes elections can bring more international legitimacy. But the generals will still rule, and opposition groups are boycottin...
